To form the dough for baking, punch down, and divide dough in half. On a floured surface, roll
each ball of dough into a 12‚Äù circle and spread with soft butter. Cut each circle into 12 wedges (like pizza).
Roll each wedge from the outer edge towards the tip and place tip side down on a lightly greased baking sheet,
leaving room for the rolls to expand. Cover the pans with a towel and place in a warm place to rise until double,
about an hour. Bake rolls in 400 degree oven for 12 to 15 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm with butter.
